speech.speaker: GOWER
speech.line: Imagine Pericles arrived at Tyre,
Welcomed and settled to his own desire.
His woeful queen we leave at Ephesus,
Unto Diana there a votaress.
Now to Marina bend your mind,
Whom our fast-growing scene must find
At Tarsus, and by Cleon train'd
In music, letters; who hath gain'd
Of education all the grace,
Which makes her both the heart and place
Of general wonder. But, alack,
That monster envy, oft the wrack
Of earned praise, Marina's life
Seeks to take off by treason's knife.
And in this kind hath our Cleon
One daughter, and a wench full grown,
Even ripe for marriage-rite; this maid
Hight Philoten: and it is said
For certain in our story, she
Would ever with Marina be:
Be't when she weaved the sleided silk
With fingers long, small, white as milk;
Or when she would with sharp needle wound
The cambric, which she made more sound
By hurting it; or when to the lute
She sung, and made the night-bird mute,
That still records with moan; or when
She would with rich and constant pen
Vail to her mistress Dian; still
This Philoten contends in skill
With absolute Marina: so
With the dove of Paphos might the crow
Vie feathers white. Marina gets
All praises, which are paid as debts,
And not as given. This so darks
In Philoten all graceful marks,
That Cleon's wife, with envy rare,
A present murderer does prepare
For good Marina, that her daughter
Might stand peerless by this slaughter.
The sooner her vile thoughts to stead,
Lychorida, our nurse, is dead:
And cursed Dionyza hath
The pregnant instrument of wrath
Prest for this blow. The unborn event
I do commend to your content:
Only I carry winged time
Post on the lame feet of my rhyme;
Which never could I so convey,
Unless your thoughts went on my way.
Dionyza does appear,
With Leonine, a murderer.

scene.title: SCENE I. Tarsus. An open place near the sea-shore.

speech.speaker: DIONYZA
speech.line: Thy oath remember; thou hast sworn to do't:
'Tis but a blow, which never shall be known.
Thou canst not do a thing in the world so soon,
To yield thee so much profit. Let not conscience,
Which is but cold, inflaming love i' thy bosom,
Inflame too nicely; nor let pity, which
Even women have cast off, melt thee, but be
A soldier to thy purpose.

speech.speaker: LEONINE
speech.line: I will do't; but yet she is a goodly creature.

speech.speaker: DIONYZA
speech.line: The fitter, then, the gods should have her. Here
she comes weeping for her only mistress' death.
Thou art resolved?

speech.speaker: LEONINE
speech.line: I am resolved.

scene-body.stagedir: Enter MARINA, with a basket of flowers

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: No, I will rob Tellus of her weed,
To strew thy green with flowers: the yellows, blues,
The purple violets, and marigolds,
Shall as a carpet hang upon thy grave,
While summer-days do last. Ay me! poor maid,
Born in a tempest, when my mother died,
This world to me is like a lasting storm,
Whirring me from my friends.

speech.speaker: DIONYZA
speech.line: How now, Marina! why do you keep alone?
How chance my daughter is not with you? Do not
Consume your blood with sorrowing: you have
A nurse of me. Lord, how your favour's changed
With this unprofitable woe!
Come, give me your flowers, ere the sea mar it.
Walk with Leonine; the air is quick there,
And it pierces and sharpens the stomach. Come,
Leonine, take her by the arm, walk with her.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: No, I pray you;
I'll not bereave you of your servant.

speech.speaker: DIONYZA
speech.line: Come, come;
I love the king your father, and yourself,
With more than foreign heart. We every day
Expect him here: when he shall come and find
Our paragon to all reports thus blasted,
He will repent the breadth of his great voyage;
Blame both my lord and me, that we have taken
No care to your best courses. Go, I pray you,
Walk, and be cheerful once again; reserve
That excellent complexion, which did steal
The eyes of young and old. Care not for me
I can go home alone.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: Well, I will go;
But yet I have no desire to it.

speech.speaker: DIONYZA
speech.line: Come, come, I know 'tis good for you.
Walk half an hour, Leonine, at the least:
Remember what I have said.

speech.speaker: LEONINE
speech.line: I warrant you, madam.

speech.speaker: DIONYZA
speech.line: I'll leave you, my sweet lady, for a while:
Pray, walk softly, do not heat your blood:
What! I must have a care of you.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: My thanks, sweet madam.
Is this wind westerly that blows?

speech.speaker: LEONINE
speech.line: South-west.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: When I was born, the wind was north.

speech.speaker: LEONINE
speech.line: Was't so?

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: My father, as nurse said, did never fear,
But cried 'Good seaman!' to the sailors, galling
His kingly hands, haling ropes;
And, clasping to the mast, endured a sea
That almost burst the deck.

speech.speaker: LEONINE
speech.line: When was this?

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: When I was born:
Never was waves nor wind more violent;
And from the ladder-tackle washes off
A canvas-climber. 'Ha!' says one, 'wilt out?'
And with a dropping industry they skip
From stem to stern: the boatswain whistles, and
The master calls, and trebles their confusion.

speech.speaker: LEONINE
speech.line: Come, say your prayers.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: What mean you?

speech.speaker: LEONINE
speech.line: If you require a little space for prayer,
I grant it: pray; but be not tedious,
For the gods are quick of ear, and I am sworn
To do my work with haste.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: Why will you kill me?

speech.speaker: LEONINE
speech.line: To satisfy my lady.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: Why would she have me kill'd?
Now, as I can remember, by my troth,
I never did her hurt in all my life:
I never spake bad word, nor did ill turn
To any living creature: believe me, la,
I never kill'd a mouse, nor hurt a fly:
I trod upon a worm against my will,
But I wept for it. How have I offended,
Wherein my death might yield her any profit,
Or my life imply her any danger?

speech.speaker: LEONINE
speech.line: My commission
Is not to reason of the deed, but do it.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: You will not do't for all the world, I hope.
You are well favour'd, and your looks foreshow
You have a gentle heart. I saw you lately,
When you caught hurt in parting two that fought:
Good sooth, it show'd well in you: do so now:
Your lady seeks my life; come you between,
And save poor me, the weaker.

speech.speaker: LEONINE
speech.line: I am sworn,
And will dispatch.

speech.speaker: First Pirate
speech.line: Hold, villain!

speech.speaker: Second Pirate
speech.line: A prize! a prize!

speech.speaker: Third Pirate
speech.line: Half-part, mates, half-part.
Come, let's have her aboard suddenly.

speech.speaker: LEONINE
speech.line: These roguing thieves serve the great pirate Valdes;
And they have seized Marina. Let her go:
There's no hope she will return. I'll swear
she's dead,
And thrown into the sea. But I'll see further:
Perhaps they will but please themselves upon her,
Not carry her aboard. If she remain,
Whom they have ravish'd must by me be slain.

scene.title: SCENE II. Mytilene. A room in a brothel.

speech.speaker: Pandar
speech.line: Boult!

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: Sir?

speech.speaker: Pandar
speech.line: Search the market narrowly; Mytilene is full of
gallants. We lost too much money this mart by being
too wenchless.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: We were never so much out of creatures. We have but
poor three, and they can do no more than they can
do; and they with continual action are even as good as rotten.

speech.speaker: Pandar
speech.line: Therefore let's have fresh ones, whate'er we pay for
them. If there be not a conscience to be used in
every trade, we shall never prosper.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Thou sayest true: 'tis not our bringing up of poor
bastards,--as, I think, I have brought up some eleven--

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: Ay, to eleven; and brought them down again. But
shall I search the market?

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: What else, man? The stuff we have, a strong wind
will blow it to pieces, they are so pitifully sodden.

speech.speaker: Pandar
speech.line: Thou sayest true; they're too unwholesome, o'
conscience. The poor Transylvanian is dead, that
lay with the little baggage.

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: Ay, she quickly pooped him; she made him roast-meat
for worms. But I'll go search the market.

speech.speaker: Pandar
speech.line: Three or four thousand chequins were as pretty a
proportion to live quietly, and so give over.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Why to give over, I pray you? is it a shame to get
when we are old?

speech.speaker: Pandar
speech.line: O, our credit comes not in like the commodity, nor
the commodity wages not with the danger: therefore,
if in our youths we could pick up some pretty
estate, 'twere not amiss to keep our door hatched.
Besides, the sore terms we stand upon with the gods
will be strong with us for giving over.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Come, other sorts offend as well as we.

speech.speaker: Pandar
speech.line: As well as we! ay, and better too; we offend worse.
Neither is our profession any trade; it's no
calling. But here comes Boult.

scene-body.stagedir: Re-enter BOULT, with the Pirates and MARINA

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: To MARINA Come your ways. My masters, you say
she's a virgin?

speech.speaker: First Pirate
speech.line: O, sir, we doubt it not.

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: Master, I have gone through for this piece, you see:
if you like her, so; if not, I have lost my earnest.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Boult, has she any qualities?

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: She has a good face, speaks well, and has excellent
good clothes: there's no further necessity of
qualities can make her be refused.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: What's her price, Boult?

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: I cannot be bated one doit of a thousand pieces.

speech.speaker: Pandar
speech.line: Well, follow me, my masters, you shall have your
money presently. Wife, take her in; instruct her
what she has to do, that she may not be raw in her
entertainment.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Boult, take you the marks of her, the colour of her
hair, complexion, height, age, with warrant of her
virginity; and cry 'He that will give most shall
have her first.' Such a maidenhead were no cheap
thing, if men were as they have been. Get this done
as I command you.

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: Performance shall follow.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: Alack that Leonine was so slack, so slow!
He should have struck, not spoke; or that these pirates,
Not enough barbarous, had not o'erboard thrown me
For to seek my mother!

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Why lament you, pretty one?

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: That I am pretty.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Come, the gods have done their part in you.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: I accuse them not.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: You are light into my hands, where you are like to live.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: The more my fault
To scape his hands where I was like to die.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Ay, and you shall live in pleasure.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: No.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Yes, indeed shall you, and taste gentlemen of all
fashions: you shall fare well; you shall have the
difference of all complexions. What! do you stop your ears?

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: Are you a woman?

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: What would you have me be, an I be not a woman?

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: An honest woman, or not a woman.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Marry, whip thee, gosling: I think I shall have
something to do with you. Come, you're a young
foolish sapling, and must be bowed as I would have
you.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: The gods defend me!

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: If it please the gods to defend you by men, then men
must comfort you, men must feed you, men must stir
you up. Boult's returned.
Now, sir, hast thou cried her through the market?

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: I have cried her almost to the number of her hairs;
I have drawn her picture with my voice.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: And I prithee tell me, how dost thou find the
inclination of the people, especially of the younger sort?

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: 'Faith, they listened to me as they would have
hearkened to their father's testament. There was a
Spaniard's mouth so watered, that he went to bed to
her very description.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: We shall have him here to-morrow with his best ruff on.

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: To-night, to-night. But, mistress, do you know the
French knight that cowers i' the hams?

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Who, Monsieur Veroles?

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: Ay, he: he offered to cut a caper at the
proclamation; but he made a groan at it, and swore
he would see her to-morrow.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Well, well; as for him, he brought his disease
hither: here he does but repair it. I know he will
come in our shadow, to scatter his crowns in the
sun.

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: Well, if we had of every nation a traveller, we
should lodge them with this sign.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: To MARINA Pray you, come hither awhile. You
have fortunes coming upon you. Mark me: you must
seem to do that fearfully which you commit
willingly, despise profit where you have most gain.
To weep that you live as ye do makes pity in your
lovers: seldom but that pity begets you a good
opinion, and that opinion a mere profit.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: I understand you not.

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: O, take her home, mistress, take her home: these
blushes of hers must be quenched with some present practise.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Thou sayest true, i' faith, so they must; for your
bride goes to that with shame which is her way to go
with warrant.

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: 'Faith, some do, and some do not. But, mistress, if
I have bargained for the joint,--

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Thou mayst cut a morsel off the spit.

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: I may so.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Who should deny it? Come, young one, I like the
manner of your garments well.

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: Ay, by my faith, they shall not be changed yet.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Boult, spend thou that in the town: report what a
sojourner we have; you'll lose nothing by custom.
When nature flamed this piece, she meant thee a good
turn; therefore say what a paragon she is, and thou
hast the harvest out of thine own report.

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: I warrant you, mistress, thunder shall not so awake
the beds of eels as my giving out her beauty stir up
the lewdly-inclined. I'll bring home some to-night.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Come your ways; follow me.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: If fires be hot, knives sharp, or waters deep,
Untied I still my virgin knot will keep.
Diana, aid my purpose!

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: What have we to do with Diana? Pray you, will you go with us?

scene.title: SCENE III. Tarsus. A room in CLEON's house.

speech.speaker: DIONYZA
speech.line: Why, are you foolish? Can it be undone?

speech.speaker: CLEON
speech.line: O Dionyza, such a piece of slaughter
The sun and moon ne'er look'd upon!

speech.speaker: DIONYZA
speech.line: I think
You'll turn a child again.

speech.speaker: CLEON
speech.line: Were I chief lord of all this spacious world,
I'ld give it to undo the deed. O lady,
Much less in blood than virtue, yet a princess
To equal any single crown o' the earth
I' the justice of compare! O villain Leonine!
Whom thou hast poison'd too:
If thou hadst drunk to him, 't had been a kindness
Becoming well thy fact: what canst thou say
When noble Pericles shall demand his child?

speech.speaker: DIONYZA
speech.line: That she is dead. Nurses are not the fates,
To foster it, nor ever to preserve.
She died at night; I'll say so. Who can cross it?
Unless you play the pious innocent,
And for an honest attribute cry out
'She died by foul play.'

speech.speaker: CLEON
speech.line: O, go to. Well, well,
Of all the faults beneath the heavens, the gods
Do like this worst.

speech.speaker: DIONYZA
speech.line: Be one of those that think
The petty wrens of Tarsus will fly hence,
And open this to Pericles. I do shame
To think of what a noble strain you are,
And of how coward a spirit.

speech.speaker: CLEON
speech.line: To such proceeding
Who ever but his approbation added,
Though not his prime consent, he did not flow
From honourable sources.

speech.speaker: DIONYZA
speech.line: Be it so, then:
Yet none does know, but you, how she came dead,
Nor none can know, Leonine being gone.
She did disdain my child, and stood between
Her and her fortunes: none would look on her,
But cast their gazes on Marina's face;
Whilst ours was blurted at and held a malkin
Not worth the time of day. It pierced me through;
And though you call my course unnatural,
You not your child well loving, yet I find
It greets me as an enterprise of kindness
Perform'd to your sole daughter.

speech.speaker: CLEON
speech.line: Heavens forgive it!

speech.speaker: DIONYZA
speech.line: And as for Pericles,
What should he say? We wept after her hearse,
And yet we mourn: her monument
Is almost finish'd, and her epitaphs
In glittering golden characters express
A general praise to her, and care in us
At whose expense 'tis done.

speech.speaker: CLEON
speech.line: Thou art like the harpy,
Which, to betray, dost, with thine angel's face,
Seize with thine eagle's talons.

speech.speaker: DIONYZA
speech.line: You are like one that superstitiously
Doth swear to the gods that winter kills the flies:
But yet I know you'll do as I advise.

scene-body.stagedir: Enter GOWER, before the monument of MARINA at Tarsus

speech.speaker: GOWER
speech.line: Thus time we waste, and longest leagues make short;
Sail seas in cockles, have an wish but for't;
Making, to take your imagination,
From bourn to bourn, region to region.
By you being pardon'd, we commit no crime
To use one language in each several clime
Where our scenes seem to live. I do beseech you
To learn of me, who stand i' the gaps to teach you,
The stages of our story. Pericles
Is now again thwarting the wayward seas,
Attended on by many a lord and knight.
To see his daughter, all his life's delight.
Old Escanes, whom Helicanus late
Advanced in time to great and high estate,
Is left to govern. Bear you it in mind,
Old Helicanus goes along behind.
Well-sailing ships and bounteous winds have brought
This king to Tarsus,--think his pilot thought;
So with his steerage shall your thoughts grow on,--
To fetch his daughter home, who first is gone.
Like motes and shadows see them move awhile;
Your ears unto your eyes I'll reconcile.
speech.stagedir: Enter PERICLES, at one door, with all his train; CLEON and DIONYZA, at the other. CLEON shows PERICLES the tomb; whereat PERICLES makes lamentation, puts on sackcloth, and in a mighty passion departs. Then exeunt CLEON and DIONYZA
speech.line: See how belief may suffer by foul show!
This borrow'd passion stands for true old woe;
And Pericles, in sorrow all devour'd,
With sighs shot through, and biggest tears
o'ershower'd,
Leaves Tarsus and again embarks. He swears
Never to wash his face, nor cut his hairs:
He puts on sackcloth, and to sea. He bears
A tempest, which his mortal vessel tears,
And yet he rides it out. Now please you wit.
The epitaph is for Marina writ
By wicked Dionyza.
speech.stagedir: Reads the inscription on MARINA's monument
speech.line: 'The fairest, sweet'st, and best lies here,
Who wither'd in her spring of year.
She was of Tyrus the king's daughter,
On whom foul death hath made this slaughter;
Marina was she call'd; and at her birth,
Thetis, being proud, swallow'd some part o' the earth:
Therefore the earth, fearing to be o'erflow'd,
Hath Thetis' birth-child on the heavens bestow'd:
Wherefore she does, and swears she'll never stint,
Make raging battery upon shores of flint.'
No visor does become black villany
So well as soft and tender flattery.
Let Pericles believe his daughter's dead,
And bear his courses to be ordered
By Lady Fortune; while our scene must play
His daughter's woe and heavy well-a-day
In her unholy service. Patience, then,
And think you now are all in Mytilene.

scene.title: SCENE V. Mytilene. A street before the brothel.

scene-body.stagedir: Enter, from the brothel, two Gentlemen

speech.speaker: First Gentleman
speech.line: Did you ever hear the like?

speech.speaker: Second Gentleman
speech.line: No, nor never shall do in such a place as this, she
being once gone.

speech.speaker: First Gentleman
speech.line: But to have divinity preached there! did you ever
dream of such a thing?

speech.speaker: Second Gentleman
speech.line: No, no. Come, I am for no more bawdy-houses:
shall's go hear the vestals sing?

speech.speaker: First Gentleman
speech.line: I'll do any thing now that is virtuous; but I
am out of the road of rutting for ever.

scene.title: SCENE VI. The same. A room in the brothel.

speech.speaker: Pandar
speech.line: Well, I had rather than twice the worth of her she
had ne'er come here.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Fie, fie upon her! she's able to freeze the god
Priapus, and undo a whole generation. We must
either get her ravished, or be rid of her. When she
should do for clients her fitment, and do me the
kindness of our profession, she has me her quirks,
her reasons, her master reasons, her prayers, her
knees; that she would make a puritan of the devil,
if he should cheapen a kiss of her.

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: 'Faith, I must ravish her, or she'll disfurnish us
of all our cavaliers, and make our swearers priests.

speech.speaker: Pandar
speech.line: Now, the pox upon her green-sickness for me!

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: 'Faith, there's no way to be rid on't but by the
way to the pox. Here comes the Lord Lysimachus disguised.

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: We should have both lord and lown, if the peevish
baggage would but give way to customers.

speech.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
speech.line: How now! How a dozen of virginities?

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Now, the gods to-bless your honour!

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: I am glad to see your honour in good health.

speech.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
speech.line: You may so; 'tis the better for you that your
resorters stand upon sound legs. How now!
wholesome iniquity have you that a man may deal
withal, and defy the surgeon?

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: We have here one, sir, if she would--but there never
came her like in Mytilene.

speech.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
speech.line: If she'ld do the deed of darkness, thou wouldst say.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Your honour knows what 'tis to say well enough.

speech.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
speech.line: Well, call forth, call forth.

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: For flesh and blood, sir, white and red, you shall
see a rose; and she were a rose indeed, if she had but--

speech.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
speech.line: What, prithee?

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: O, sir, I can be modest.

speech.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
speech.line: That dignifies the renown of a bawd, no less than it
gives a good report to a number to be chaste.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Here comes that which grows to the stalk; never
plucked yet, I can assure you.
Is she not a fair creature?

speech.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
speech.line: 'Faith, she would serve after a long voyage at sea.
Well, there's for you: leave us.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: I beseech your honour, give me leave: a word, and
I'll have done presently.

speech.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
speech.line: I beseech you, do.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: To MARINA First, I would have you note, this is
an honourable man.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: I desire to find him so, that I may worthily note him.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Next, he's the governor of this country, and a man
whom I am bound to.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: If he govern the country, you are bound to him
indeed; but how honourable he is in that, I know not.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Pray you, without any more virginal fencing, will
you use him kindly? He will line your apron with gold.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: What he will do graciously, I will thankfully receive.

speech.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
speech.line: Ha' you done?

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: My lord, she's not paced yet: you must take some
pains to work her to your manage. Come, we will
leave his honour and her together. Go thy ways.

speech.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
speech.line: Now, pretty one, how long have you been at this trade?

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: What trade, sir?

speech.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
speech.line: Why, I cannot name't but I shall offend.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: I cannot be offended with my trade. Please you to name it.

speech.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
speech.line: How long have you been of this profession?

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: E'er since I can remember.

speech.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
speech.line: Did you go to 't so young? Were you a gamester at
five or at seven?

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: Earlier too, sir, if now I be one.

speech.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
speech.line: Why, the house you dwell in proclaims you to be a
creature of sale.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: Do you know this house to be a place of such resort,
and will come into 't? I hear say you are of
honourable parts, and are the governor of this place.

speech.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
speech.line: Why, hath your principal made known unto you who I am?

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: Who is my principal?

speech.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
speech.line: Why, your herb-woman; she that sets seeds and roots
of shame and iniquity. O, you have heard something
of my power, and so stand aloof for more serious
wooing. But I protest to thee, pretty one, my
authority shall not see thee, or else look friendly
upon thee. Come, bring me to some private place:
come, come.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: If you were born to honour, show it now;
If put upon you, make the judgment good
That thought you worthy of it.

speech.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
speech.line: How's this? how's this? Some more; be sage.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: For me,
That am a maid, though most ungentle fortune
Have placed me in this sty, where, since I came,
Diseases have been sold dearer than physic,
O, that the gods
Would set me free from this unhallow'd place,
Though they did change me to the meanest bird
That flies i' the purer air!

speech.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
speech.line: I did not think
Thou couldst have spoke so well; ne'er dream'd thou couldst.
Had I brought hither a corrupted mind,
Thy speech had alter'd it. Hold, here's gold for thee:
Persever in that clear way thou goest,
And the gods strengthen thee!

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: The good gods preserve you!

speech.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
speech.line: For me, be you thoughten
That I came with no ill intent; for to me
The very doors and windows savour vilely.
Fare thee well. Thou art a piece of virtue, and
I doubt not but thy training hath been noble.
Hold, here's more gold for thee.
A curse upon him, die he like a thief,
That robs thee of thy goodness! If thou dost
Hear from me, it shall be for thy good.

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: I beseech your honour, one piece for me.

speech.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
speech.line: Avaunt, thou damned door-keeper!
Your house, but for this virgin that doth prop it,
Would sink and overwhelm you. Away!

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: How's this? We must take another course with you.
If your peevish chastity, which is not worth a
breakfast in the cheapest country under the cope,
shall undo a whole household, let me be gelded like
a spaniel. Come your ways.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: Whither would you have me?

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: I must have your maidenhead taken off, or the common
hangman shall execute it. Come your ways. We'll
have no more gentlemen driven away. Come your ways, I say.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: How now! what's the matter?

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: Worse and worse, mistress; she has here spoken holy
words to the Lord Lysimachus.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: O abominable!

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: She makes our profession as it were to stink afore
the face of the gods.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Marry, hang her up for ever!

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: The nobleman would have dealt with her like a
nobleman, and she sent him away as cold as a
snowball; saying his prayers too.

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: Boult, take her away; use her at thy pleasure:
crack the glass of her virginity, and make the rest malleable.

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: An if she were a thornier piece of ground than she
is, she shall be ploughed.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: Hark, hark, you gods!

speech.speaker: Bawd
speech.line: She conjures: away with her! Would she had never
come within my doors! Marry, hang you! She's born
to undo us. Will you not go the way of women-kind?
Marry, come up, my dish of chastity with rosemary and bays!

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: Come, mistress; come your ways with me.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: Whither wilt thou have me?

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: To take from you the jewel you hold so dear.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: Prithee, tell me one thing first.

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: Come now, your one thing.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: What canst thou wish thine enemy to be?

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: Why, I could wish him to be my master, or rather, my mistress.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: Neither of these are so bad as thou art,
Since they do better thee in their command.
Thou hold'st a place, for which the pained'st fiend
Of hell would not in reputation change:
Thou art the damned doorkeeper to every
Coistrel that comes inquiring for his Tib;
To the choleric fisting of every rogue
Thy ear is liable; thy food is such
As hath been belch'd on by infected lungs.

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: What would you have me do? go to the wars, would
you? where a man may serve seven years for the loss
of a leg, and have not money enough in the end to
buy him a wooden one?

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: Do any thing but this thou doest. Empty
Old receptacles, or common shores, of filth;
Serve by indenture to the common hangman:
Any of these ways are yet better than this;
For what thou professest, a baboon, could he speak,
Would own a name too dear. O, that the gods
Would safely deliver me from this place!
Here, here's gold for thee.
If that thy master would gain by thee,
Proclaim that I can sing, weave, sew, and dance,
With other virtues, which I'll keep from boast:
And I will undertake all these to teach.
I doubt not but this populous city will
Yield many scholars.

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: But can you teach all this you speak of?

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: Prove that I cannot, take me home again,
And prostitute me to the basest groom
That doth frequent your house.

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: Well, I will see what I can do for thee: if I can
place thee, I will.

speech.speaker: MARINA
speech.line: But amongst honest women.

speech.speaker: BOULT
speech.line: 'Faith, my acquaintance lies little amongst them.
But since my master and mistress have bought you,
there's no going but by their consent: therefore I
will make them acquainted with your purpose, and I
doubt not but I shall find them tractable enough.
Come, I'll do for thee what I can; come your ways.
